studyDesigns.name: Study Design
studyDesigns.rationale: Protocol-defined study design for investigating efficacy and safety

arms.name: ALXN1840 Single-Arm
arms.description: Single-arm, open-label, repeat-dose administration of ALXN1840 initiated at 15 mg once daily for approximately 28 days, followed by intra-patient titration to 30 mg once daily on Day 29, with allowable dose modification between 15 mg every other day and 30 mg/day based on safety.

studyCohorts.name: Cohort 1: Treatment-experienced
studyCohorts.characteristic: Participants with Wilson disease who have received Wilson disease therapy (standard of care therapies or ALXN1840) for more than 28 days prior to enrollment.

studyCohorts.name: Cohort 2: Treatment-naïve
studyCohorts.characteristic: Participants with Wilson disease who have received Wilson disease therapy for 28 days or less prior to enrollment.

eligibilityCriteria.name: Ability to comply with study procedures
Recent alcohol use / positive breath test
Inability to comply with controlled menu

objectives.name: Primary Objective
objectives.text: Assess net copper balance with daily repeat-dose ALXN1840 treatment (15 mg and 30 mg) in participants with Wilson disease (WD)

objectives.name: Secondary Objective 1
objectives.text: Assess change in copper balance in response to ALXN1840 15 mg/day and 30 mg/day during ALXN1840 accumulation and at steady state periods versus the pretreatment baseline in participants with WD

objectives.name: Secondary Objective 2
objectives.text: Investigate the effect of ALXN1840 (15 mg/day and 30 mg/day) on the disposition of copper in participants with WD

objectives.name: Secondary Objective 3
objectives.text: Investigate the effect of ALXN1840 on the disposition of molybdenum at steady state at 15 mg/day and 30 mg/day in participants with WD

objectives.name: Secondary Objective 4
objectives.text: Assess steady-state total molybdenum balance as a measure of ALXN1840 15 mg/day and 30 mg/day in participants with WD

objectives.name: Secondary Objective 5
objectives.text: Assess accumulation of molybdenum with ALXN1840 treatment at 15 mg/day and 30 mg/day in participants with WD

objectives.name: Secondary Objective 6
objectives.text: Determine the steady-state plasma pharmacokinetic (PK) of total molybdenum and plasma ultrafiltrate (PUF) molybdenum (as surrogate measures of ALXN1840, 15 mg and 30 mg) in participants with WD

objectives.name: Safety Objective
objectives.text: Evaluate the safety and tolerability of repeated-dose administration of ALXN1840 15 mg/day and 30 mg/day in participants with WD

objectives.name: Exploratory Objective 1
objectives.text: Determine dose response of ALXN1840 15 mg/day and 30 mg/day for copper balance in participants with WD

objectives.name: Exploratory Objective 2
objectives.text: Determine the effect of treatment duration on copper balance in participants with WD

objectives.name: Exploratory Objective 3
objectives.text: Assess the effects of ALXN1840 on ceruloplasmin, ceruloplasmin-bound copper LBC profiles in plasma in participants with WD

endpoints.name: Primary Endpoint
endpoints.text: Mean daily copper balance where copper balance is measured by the calculated difference between copper intake (in food and drink) and copper output (in feces and urine) during ALXN1840 accumulation and steady-state periods for each dose

endpoints.name: Secondary Endpoint 1
endpoints.text: Change in mean daily copper balance as measured by the calculated difference between copper intake (in food and drink) and copper output (in feces and urine) from pretreatment baseline (Days -4 through -1) and ALXN1840 accumulation and steady-state periods for each dose

endpoints.name: Secondary Endpoint 2
endpoints.text: Copper quantified in food, drink, feces, and urine, including plasma total and labile bound copper (LBC) during ALXN1840 accumulation and steady-state periods for each dose

endpoints.name: Secondary Endpoint 3
endpoints.text: Molybdenum quantified in food, drink, feces, and urine, plasma total molybdenum at ALXN1840 steady state

endpoints.name: Secondary Endpoint 4
endpoints.text: Mean daily molybdenum balance as demonstrated through measurement of molybdenum intake (in food, drink and ALXN1840), and molybdenum output (feces and urine) representing ALXN1840 steady state

endpoints.name: Secondary Endpoint 5
endpoints.text: Accumulation of molybdenum as determined by molybdenum balance

endpoints.name: Secondary Endpoint 6
endpoints.text: PK parameters for plasma total and PUF-molybdenum

endpoints.name: Safety Endpoint
endpoints.text:
Safety parameters:
• Treatment emergent adverse events (TEAEs)/serious adverse events (SAEs)
• Clinical laboratory assessments (serum chemistry, hematology, coagulation, and urinalysis)
• Physical examinations
• Heart rate, intervals (PR, QRS, QT and QTc), and clinically significant electrocardiogram (ECG) findings as determined by triplicate 12-lead ECG
• Vital sign assessments (blood pressure and heart rate)

endpoints.name: Exploratory Endpoint 1
endpoints.text: Assess dose response of ALXN1840 on copper balance focusing on copper balance

endpoints.name: Exploratory Endpoint 2
endpoints.text: Determine the effect of time following initiation of ALXN1840 treatment on copper balance

endpoints.name: Exploratory Endpoint 3
endpoints.text: Ceruloplasmin, ceruloplasmin-bound copper, and LBC: Change in ceruloplasmin at Days 1, 8, 25, 29, 36, and Day 39 compared with predose

studyInterventions.name: ALXN1840
studyInterventions.description: Oral bis-choline tetrathiomolybdate administered once daily at 15 mg and 30 mg doses to participants with Wilson disease

studyInterventions.name: Copper- and molybdenum-controlled diet
studyInterventions.description: Standardized copper- and molybdenum-controlled meals provided during inpatient periods to control dietary copper and molybdenum intake

activities.name: Chemistryq, hematology, Coagulation
activities.description: Clinical laboratory assessments including serum chemistry, hematology, and coagulation parameters

activities.name: Retained serum sample (safety)t
activities.description: Retained serum sample for safety evaluation

activities.name: Vitals sign measurementsu
activities.description: Vital signs measurements including body temperature, heart rate, respiratory rate, and blood pressure

activities.name: Adverse events
activities.description: Assessment and recording of adverse events

activities.name: Urination and bowel movement monitoring, menstruation checks
activities.description: Monitoring of urination and bowel movements, and menstruation checks

activities.name: 24-hour urine for Cu and Mow
activities.description: 24-hour urine collection for copper and molybdenum

activities.name: Feces for Cu and Mox
activities.description: Fecal collection for copper and molybdenum

activities.name: Concomitant medication and non-pharmacologic therapy/procedure
activities.description: Documentation of concomitant medication and non-pharmacologic therapy or procedure

notes.text: a Within 42 days of ALXN1840 administration. Details of procedures that may be performed by sites designated as “screening sites” (only in the US) are detailed in Section 8.
b Participants will be admitted to the clinical research unit (CRU) at least 10 hours prior to enrollment and initiation of copper- and molybdenum-controlled diet.
c At the CRU’s discretion, participants may remain in the CRU or be readmitted on Day 22 with all procedures starting on Day 23.
d Unscheduled study visits may occur at any time during the study and may include any study procedure as deemed necessary by the Investigator.
e Participants are required to return to the CRU Day 54+/−2; participants will be discontinued from ALXN1840 medication by their physician at the latest by the Day 54 follow-up.

f Discharge from the unit may occur after completion of all procedures on Day 9 and on Day 40 and after the Investigator has reviewed all safety assessment (including safety laboratory tests) and confirmed that the participant is appropriate for discharge.

g A single outpatient visit or phone call and safety laboratory assessment should occur between Day 14 and Day 18. A phone call may take place on a different day than the blood draw within the Day 14 through Day 18 period.
h If needed to confirm menopause.
i Parameters include age and sex. Race and ethnicity will be collected where permitted by local regulations.
j Wilson disease history will include diagnosis date, method of diagnosis, history of cirrhosis, details of any previous liver biopsies performed, and treatment received.

k A full physical examination will be performed at Screening, at check-in for the study, and at the End of the study/Early Termination Visit. A physical examination should also be performed on any participants with ongoing adverse events prior to discharge from the unit. Otherwise, a symptom-driven physical examination may be performed at other times, at the Principal Investigator’s discretion.
l Height at screening only.

m While in the CRU, study intervention will be administered after an overnight fast (ie, at least 10 hours) at the same time every morning; drug is to be administered with 240 mL of water and meals should be delayed a minimum of 2 hours after dosing. As an outpatient, participants are expected to take ALXN1840 at approximately the same time daily (+/−1 hour). Participants should take the medication with a glass of water on an empty stomach; meals should be delayed a minimum of 2 hours after dosing.
n During the outpatient period, participants will use SMS text messaging to confirm study intervention administration.
o Blood sampling for PK/PD will occur before ALXN1840 administration and represents a predose trough. See Table 2 for PK/PD sampling on Days 1, 25, 29, and 39.
p PK/PD collection will include timepoints described in the schedule of PK/PD assessment for Days 1, 25, 29, and 39 (Table 2).

q Samples for serum chemistry will be obtained following a fast of at least 8 hours at the Screening Visit and at check-in. In case of rechecks, and postdose serum chemistry, participants may not have fasted for 6 or 8 hours before the serum chemistry sample is taken.
r Laboratory assessment including chemistry, hematology, and coagulation parameters should be performed on Days -8, -1, 8, 23, and 28 only.

s Menstruation check is for women only; women of childbearing potential should only be enrolled after a negative serum pregnancy test result at Screening. Additional urine pregnancy testing will be standard for the protocol unless serum testing is required by site policies, local regulation, or Institutional Review Boards (IRBs)/Independent Ethics Committees (IECs) (Section 10.2). In addition to pregnancy tests detailed at the visits in the SoA, females of childbearing potential will be required to perform urine pregnancy tests at least every 4 weeks at their home or the study site throughout their time in the study.
t A single 15 mL serum sample will be retained for evaluation in the event of an unexpected safety finding; retained samples may be destroyed after completion of the clinical study report.

u Vital signs measurements and ECGs should be performed before dosing, unless otherwise specified. Vitals signs include body temperature, heart rate, respiratory rate, and systolic and diastolic blood pressure.

v Copper- and molybdenum-controlled diet will be initiated after registration/inclusion. Participants will remain on a copper/molybdenum controlled diet throughout both the inpatient Period 1 (Day 8 to Day 9) and inpatient Period 2 (Day 23 to Day 40); during this time participants will be strongly encouraged to eat all meals. While not in the CRU, participants will be encouraged to adhere to their usual copper-controlled diet.
w For each input/output balance period, 24-hour urine samples are to be collected for measurement of copper and molybdenum.
x For fecal samples, each individual sample will be independently collected with record of date, time, and weight of the sample.

y Abbreviations: AE = adverse event; BMI = body mass index; C-1 = check-in; Cu = copper; D = day; ECG = electrocardiogram; EOS/ET = End of Study or Early Termination; HIV = human immunodeficiency virus; HR = heart rate; LBC = labile bound copper; Mo = molybdenum; OP = outpatient; PD = pharmacodynamic; PK = pharmacokinetics; PUF = plasma ultrafiltrate; UNS = unscheduled; WD = Wilson disease.
Table 2 note: Time point (hours)a: a Time points are relative to dosing (0 hours).
Table 2 note: b Hour 24 PK/PD sampling is to occur just prior to the next-day dose of ALXN1840.
Table 2 abbreviations: Cu = copper; LBC = labile bound copper; Mo = molybdenum; PD = pharmacodynamic; PK = pharmacokinetic; PUF = plasma ultrafiltrate.

titles.text: A Phase 2, Open-label Study to Assess Copper and Molybdenum Balance in Participants with Wilson Disease Treated with ALXN1840
Copper and Molybdenum Balance in Participants with Wilson Disease Treated with ALXN1840

study.name: A Phase 2, Open-label Study to Assess Copper and Molybdenum Balance in Participants with Wilson Disease Treated with ALXN1840

administrableProducts.name: ALXN1840 tablets
administrableProducts.strength: 15 mg ALXN1840 containing 7.8 mg tetrathiomolybdic acid

administrations.name: ALXN1840 15 mg once daily maintained beyond 4 weeks
administrations.duration: Up to Day 39 if escalation to 30 mg is not performed for safety reasons

administrations.name: ALXN1840 reduced dosing to 15 mg every other day (dose modification)
administrations.duration: As needed per dose modification criteria

administrations.name: ALXN1840 temporary interruption
administrations.duration: Until laboratory/safety parameters improve per protocol criteria

administrations.name: ALXN1840 outpatient dosing
administrations.dose: 15 mg or 30 mg according to assigned dose
administrations.duration: Outpatient Period between Day 9 and Day 23 (may be extended up to an additional 14 days)

substances.name: bis-choline tetrathiomolybdate
substances.description: Active pharmaceutical ingredient in ALXN1840; a copper-binding agent also referred to as tetrathiomolybdate

substances.name: tetrathiomolybdic acid
substances.description: Acid form providing the active anion tetrathiomolybdate in ALXN1840 tablets

substances.name: tetrathiomolybdate
substances.description: Active anion of ALXN1840 responsible for copper binding and decoppering effects

studyDefinitionDocument.name: A Phase 2, Open-label Study to Assess Copper and Molybdenum Balance in Participants with Wilson Disease Treated with ALXN1840

studyAmendments.summary: The main reason for preparation of this amendment was to update procedures outlined in the Schedule of Activities, remove contradictory text on the reporting of serious adverse events, and add details of an interim analysis. Additional, minor changes are included in the table below.

The main reason for preparation of this amendment was to revise the exclusion criterion for a urine drug screen. Changes implemented via Administrative Letter 1 and Administrative Letter 2, as well as COVID vaccination guidance, have also been incorporated.
The main reason for preparation of this amendment was to update the washout period for zinc. Additional changes are listed below.

The main reason for preparation of this amendment was to clarify study procedures occurring across different sites in the US, so as to facilitate participant recruitment across different regions of the US, and to lessen inconvenience for participants without compromising the quality of the study.

conditions.name: Safety Review for Dose Increase to 30 mg
conditions.description: Safety Review Committee evaluation prior to increasing dose from 15 mg/day to 30 mg/day
conditions.text: Before titration to 30 mg/day on Day 29, the Safety Review Committee will review available safety data through Day 23 for each participant.

conditions.name: Continuation on 15 mg/day Instead of Titration
conditions.description: Remain on 15 mg/day if safety concerns exist after approximately 4 weeks
conditions.text: Dosing for ALXN1840 will be initiated at 15 mg once daily for a minimum of 4 weeks, with an increase to 30 mg after 4 weeks, unless there are safety concerns that, in the opinion of the Investigator(s) and/or Alexion, may place participants at undue risk, in which case, participants may remain on the 15 mg/day dose for the duration of the study.

conditions.name: Dose Modification Criteria General Rule
conditions.description: Global rule to decrease or interrupt dose when predefined laboratory or clinical criteria are met
conditions.text: The dose should be decreased or interrupted if any of the relevant Dose Modification Criteria are met. Deviation from the dose modification guidelines must be agreed with the Alexion Medical Monitor.

conditions.name: Hematologic Dose Reduction Criteria (Example)
conditions.description: Criteria based on neutrophil decrease triggering dose reduction and restriction of increase
conditions.text: >30% decrease from baseline in participants with neutrophils below reference range at baseline: reduce dose to previous dose level if up-titration has occurred or reduce dose to 15 mg every other day if on 15 mg once daily. No further dose increase until resolution of abnormality.

conditions.name: Liver Injury Dose Interruption Criteria
conditions.description: Bilirubin and ALT criteria requiring temporary interruption and specific conditions for rechallenge
conditions.text: If bilirubin > 2 × ULN accompanied by ALT > 3 × ULN, indicative of liver injury: temporarily interrupt ALXN1840; perform weekly repeat testing; rechallenge only at 15 mg every other day or less frequent when bilirubin is below ULN and with approval of the Alexion Medical Monitor. A maximum of 3 rechallenges will be allowed.

conditions.name: Neurologic Worsening Management
conditions.description: Criteria and process for dose modification in case of neurological worsening
conditions.text: Evidence of neurologic worsening by adverse events or by neurologic physical exam assessment will prompt the Investigator and Alexion Medical Monitor to evaluate the need for dose interruption, increase, or decrease based on copper control parameters and relevant clinical data; rationale must be documented and re-evaluated at the next study visit.

conditions.name: Psychiatric Worsening Management
conditions.description: Criteria and process for dose modification in case of clinically significant psychiatric worsening
conditions.text: Evidence of clinically significant acute psychiatric worsening (including but not limited to suicidality, acute depression, or psychosis) will prompt the Investigator and Alexion Medical Monitor to evaluate the need for dose interruption, increase, or decrease based on copper control parameters and relevant clinical data; rationale must be documented and re-evaluated at the next study visit.

conditions.name: Eligibility – Zinc Washout
conditions.description: Minimum zinc-free period prior to starting ALXN1840 to avoid confounding copper balance
conditions.text: Participants must be off zinc therapy for a minimum of 21 days prior to Day 1 to prevent confounding of study results, as zinc works through upregulation of metallothionein in enterocytes resulting in elevated fecal copper excretion.

conditions.name: Eligibility – Chelator Washout
conditions.description: Required discontinuation of chelator therapy before ALXN1840 initiation for baseline copper assessment
conditions.text: To assess the copper baseline during the Inpatient Run-in Period, participants will be discontinued from their chelator therapy for approximately 4 days prior to initiating ALXN1840 while being maintained on a copper-controlled diet.

conditions.name: Eligibility – Prior ALXN1840 or Tetrathiomolybdate Exposure
conditions.description: Exclusion based on prior ALXN1840 or tetrathiomolybdate within 1 year
conditions.text: Previous treatment with ALXN1840 or other form of tetrathiomolybdate within 1 year prior to dosing is exclusionary.

conditions.name: Eligibility – Prior Experimental Therapy Washout
conditions.description: Avoid carryover from other investigational therapies
conditions.text: Use of an experimental or unapproved/unlicensed therapy at the same time or within 90 days or 5 half-lives, whichever is longer, prior to the Screening Visit is exclusionary.

conditions.name: Eligibility – Concomitant Medication Washout
conditions.description: Abstain from prescription and nonprescription medications prior to study
conditions.text: Participants must abstain from taking prescription medications within 14 days or 5 half-lives (whichever is longer) of Day -7 or nonprescription drugs, vitamins, and dietary or herbal supplements within 7 days or 5 half-lives (whichever is longer) before Day -7 and until completion of the follow-up visit, except specific allowed medications.

conditions.name: Eligibility – Pregnancy Testing and Status
conditions.description: Requirement for negative pregnancy status and ongoing testing
conditions.text: Women of childbearing potential should only be enrolled after a negative serum pregnancy test result at Screening. Additional urine pregnancy testing will be standard at protocol-defined visits, and females of childbearing potential must perform urine pregnancy tests at least every 4 weeks at their home or the study site throughout their time in the study.

conditions.name: Eligibility – Ability to Tolerate Controlled Diet
conditions.description: Requirement to complete and tolerate controlled copper/molybdenum diet
conditions.text: Participants unwilling to consistently complete every meal and tolerate a controlled, limited menu for the duration of the study are excluded. Participants will remain on a copper/molybdenum-controlled diet throughout inpatient Period 1 and 2 and are strongly encouraged to complete all meals.

conditions.name: Discontinuation of Study Intervention – Triggering Conditions
conditions.description: Conditions mandating consideration of permanent discontinuation of ALXN1840
conditions.text: Participants must be considered for discontinuation from study intervention if any of the following occur: serious hypersensitivity reaction; severe uncontrolled infection; use of disallowed medication; pregnancy or planned pregnancy; or if Alexion or the Investigator deems it necessary.

conditions.name: Discontinuation for Abnormal Liver Function
conditions.description: Link to dose modification criteria for liver-related discontinuation decisions
conditions.text: Discontinuation of study intervention for abnormal liver function should be considered when a participant meets one of the conditions outlined in the Dose Modification criteria or if the Investigator believes that it is in the best interest of the participant.

conditions.name: Clinically Significant ECG Findings Post-enrollment
conditions.description: Decision on continued participation based on ECG abnormalities
conditions.text: If a clinically significant finding is identified on ECG (including changes from baseline in QTcF) after enrollment, the Investigator or qualified designee will determine if the participant can continue in the study and if any change in participant management is needed.

conditions.name: Adaptive Design Features
conditions.description: Investigator discretion for adaptive features within defined limits without protocol amendment
conditions.text: This study incorporates the use of an adaptive design. Adaptive features may be implemented at the discretion of the Investigator to support conduct of the study and do not require amendment of the protocol; adaptive features and their limits are described in Table 4.

conditions.name: Lost to Follow-up Determination
conditions.description: Conditions under which a participant is considered lost to follow-up
conditions.text: A participant will be considered lost to follow-up if he or she repeatedly fails to return for scheduled visits and is unable to be contacted by the study site despite at least 3 telephone calls and, if necessary, a certified letter to the last known mailing address, with all attempts documented.

conditions.name: Maximum Number of Dose Rechallenges
conditions.description: Limit on rechallenge attempts after safety-related interruption
conditions.text: A maximum of 3 rechallenges will be allowed for participants in whom ALXN1840 was interrupted per dose modification criteria.

transitionRules.name: Screening/Run-in to Treatment Transition
transitionRules.text: Participants eligible for the study will be enrolled on Day -7 and initiated on a copper- and molybdenum-controlled diet, then admitted to the CRU for Treatment Period 1 on Day -8 and start ALXN1840 at 15 mg/day on Day 1 following discontinuation of chelator therapy for approximately 4 days and zinc therapy for at least 21 days.

transitionRules.name: Dose Escalation from 15 mg/day to 30 mg/day
transitionRules.text: Participants will be administered ALXN1840 at a dose of 15 mg/day on Day 1 through Day 28 and then increase to 30 mg/day on Day 29 after the Safety Review Committee reviews available safety data through Day 23. If safety concerns exist, participants may remain on 15 mg/day for the duration of the study.

transitionRules.name: Dose Reduction or Interruption Based on Safety Criteria
transitionRules.text: The dose should be decreased or interrupted if any of the relevant Dose Modification Criteria in Table 7 are met, such as hematological abnormalities, liver test abnormalities, neurologic or psychiatric worsening. Deviation from these guidelines must be agreed with the Alexion Medical Monitor.

transitionRules.name: Temporary Interruption for Liver Injury
transitionRules.text: If bilirubin > 2 × ULN accompanied by ALT > 3 × ULN indicative of liver injury occurs, ALXN1840 dosing should be temporarily interrupted, with weekly repeat testing; rechallenge, if considered, is at 15 mg every other day or less frequent when bilirubin is below ULN and requires approval of the Alexion Medical Monitor.

transitionRules.name: Dose Rechallenge After Safety Event
transitionRules.text: Following resolution of safety abnormalities triggering dose interruption, participants may be rechallenged, typically at 15 mg every other day, up to a maximum of 3 rechallenges; dose and frequency may be changed by the Investigator in consultation with the Medical Monitor.

transitionRules.name: Discontinuation of Study Intervention for Safety
transitionRules.text: Participants must be considered for discontinuation from study intervention if serious hypersensitivity reaction, severe uncontrolled infection, use of disallowed medication, pregnancy or planned pregnancy occurs, or if Alexion or the Investigator deems discontinuation is necessary.

transitionRules.name: Discontinuation of Study Intervention for Abnormal Liver Function
transitionRules.text: Discontinuation of study intervention for abnormal liver function should be considered when liver-related dose modification criteria are met or when the Investigator believes it is in the best interest of the participant.

transitionRules.name: Participant Withdrawal from Study
transitionRules.text: A participant may withdraw from the study at any time at his/her own request, or may be withdrawn at the discretion of the Investigator for safety, behavioral, compliance, or administrative reasons; an early discontinuation visit should be conducted if possible and the participant is permanently discontinued from both study intervention and study participation.

transitionRules.name: Lost to Follow-up Leading to Withdrawal
transitionRules.text: If a participant repeatedly fails to return for scheduled visits and remains unreachable despite at least 3 telephone calls and, if necessary, a certified letter, he/she will be considered to have withdrawn from the study and will be permanently discontinued.

transitionRules.name: Transition to Post-study Therapy
transitionRules.text: Following completion of both inpatient periods (Day 40), participants will either transition to therapy that was discontinued before enrollment, transition to other standard of care therapy as directed by the treating physician, or, at the discretion of the treating physician, consider continuation of ALXN1840 treatment under preapproval access.

transitionRules.name: Study-site Closure or Study Termination
transitionRules.text: Alexion may close a study site or terminate the study at any time for reasons including but not limited to Investigator non-compliance, inadequate recruitment, or discontinuation of further study intervention development; the Investigator may also initiate site closure given reasonable cause and sufficient notice.

scheduleTimelineExits.name: Study Completion for Participant
scheduleTimelineExits.description: A participant is considered to have completed the study if he or she has completed all phases of the study including the last scheduled procedure shown in the Schedule of Activities, typically the End of Study Visit on Day 54 (±2 days).

scheduleTimelineExits.name: Early Termination – Participant Withdrawal or Investigator Decision
scheduleTimelineExits.description: Early termination occurs when a participant withdraws consent at any time or is withdrawn at the discretion of the Investigator for safety, behavioral, compliance, or administrative reasons; an early discontinuation visit should be performed per the SoA.

scheduleTimelineExits.name: Early Termination – Lost to Follow-up
scheduleTimelineExits.description: If a participant repeatedly fails to return for scheduled visits and cannot be contacted despite documented attempts (at least 3 telephone calls and, if necessary, a certified letter), the participant is considered to have withdrawn from the study and is permanently discontinued.

scheduleTimelineExits.name: Discontinuation of Study Intervention Only
scheduleTimelineExits.description: In rare instances, the study intervention may be permanently discontinued for a participant while the participant remains in the study for safety follow-up; this occurs in the setting of serious hypersensitivity, severe uncontrolled infection, pregnancy, use of disallowed medication, or other safety reasons per Investigator or Sponsor judgment.

scheduleTimelineExits.name: Site-level Early Closure
scheduleTimelineExits.description: A study site may be closed before planned completion due to Investigator non-compliance with protocol or GCP, inadequate recruitment, or discontinuation of further study intervention development; all participants at the site must complete early discontinuation or end-of-study visits as applicable.

scheduleTimelineExits.name: Study-level Early Termination
scheduleTimelineExits.description: Alexion reserves the right to terminate the study at any time; in such cases all Investigators, ethics committees, regulatory authorities, and participants are informed, and appropriate participant therapy and/or follow-up is assured.

analysisPopulations.name: Screened Set
analysisPopulations.label: SSCR
analysisPopulations.description: All participants who signed informed consent and underwent any screening assessments
analysisPopulations.criteria: All participants who provided informed consent and had any screening procedure performed

analysisPopulations.name: Enrolled Set
analysisPopulations.label: ENR
analysisPopulations.description: All participants who were enrolled into the study (typically on Day -7) according to the protocol
analysisPopulations.criteria: All participants who met eligibility criteria and were formally enrolled in the study

analysisPopulations.name: Full Analysis Set
analysisPopulations.label: FAS
analysisPopulations.description: Primary efficacy analysis population, generally aligned with the ICH E9 intent‑to‑treat principle
analysisPopulations.criteria: All enrolled participants who received at least 1 dose of ALXN1840 and have sufficient intake/output data to contribute to copper/molybdenum balance assessments

analysisPopulations.name: Per Protocol Set
analysisPopulations.label: PP
analysisPopulations.description: Subset of the Full Analysis Set without major protocol deviations that could affect primary efficacy evaluation; used for sensitivity analyses when the PP Set has at least 3 participants
analysisPopulations.criteria: Participants in the Full Analysis Set who have no major protocol deviations judged to impact the assessment of copper/molybdenum balance, and who complete required baseline and on‑treatment collection periods

analysisPopulations.name: Safety Set
analysisPopulations.label: SAF
analysisPopulations.description: Population used for all safety analyses including adverse events, laboratory tests, vital signs, ECGs, and exposure
analysisPopulations.criteria: All participants who received at least 1 dose of ALXN1840

analysisPopulations.name: Pharmacokinetic Analysis Set
analysisPopulations.label: PKAS
analysisPopulations.description: Population used for PK concentration and parameter analyses of ALXN1840 and molybdenum
analysisPopulations.criteria: All participants who received at least 1 dose of ALXN1840 and have at least one evaluable PK sample (e.g. on Days 1, 25, 29, or 39) without significant PK-related protocol deviations

analysisPopulations.name: Pharmacodynamic Analysis Set
analysisPopulations.label: PDAS
analysisPopulations.description: Population used for PD analyses related to copper disposition and PD biomarkers (e.g., plasma copper measures)
analysisPopulations.criteria: All participants who received at least 1 dose of ALXN1840 and have at least one evaluable PD measurement as per protocol (e.g. during intake/output collection periods) and no major PD-related protocol deviations

characteristics.name: Age
characteristics.description: Age in years at reference date (typically date of informed consent or first dose, per SAP Appendix 9.2.2 on age and dates)

characteristics.name: Sex
characteristics.description: Sex of participant as recorded on CRF (e.g. male, female)

characteristics.name: Race
characteristics.description: Race as collected on demographics CRF (e.g. White, Black or African American, Asian, etc.)

characteristics.name: Ethnicity
characteristics.description: Ethnicity as collected on demographics CRF (e.g. Hispanic or Latino, Not Hispanic or Latino)

characteristics.name: Body Mass Index
characteristics.description: Body mass index calculated from height and weight at baseline, per SAP Appendix 9.2.5

characteristics.name: Baseline Disease Characteristics – Wilson Disease History
characteristics.description: Wilson Disease (WD) history including age at diagnosis, disease duration, clinical presentation, and relevant disease status at baseline, as summarized in Section 7.1.3.2 and 7.1.3.3

characteristics.name: Baseline Copper Balance
characteristics.description: Mean daily copper balance during pretreatment baseline (Days -4 through -1), measured as intake (food and drink) minus output (feces and urine)

characteristics.name: Baseline Molybdenum Balance
characteristics.description: Mean daily molybdenum balance during pretreatment baseline (Days -4 through -1), analogous to copper balance

characteristics.name: Baseline Copper Intake
characteristics.description: Total daily copper intake from food, drink, and study drug during the baseline collection period (Days -4 through -1)

characteristics.name: Baseline Copper Output – Urine
characteristics.description: Daily urinary copper excretion during the pretreatment baseline period

characteristics.name: Baseline Copper Output – Feces
characteristics.description: Daily fecal copper excretion during the pretreatment baseline period

characteristics.name: Baseline Molybdenum Intake
characteristics.description: Total daily molybdenum intake from food, drink, and study drug during the baseline collection period

characteristics.name: Baseline Molybdenum Output – Urine
characteristics.description: Daily urinary molybdenum excretion during the pretreatment baseline period

characteristics.name: Baseline Molybdenum Output – Feces
characteristics.description: Daily fecal molybdenum excretion during the pretreatment baseline period

characteristics.name: Baseline Plasma Copper Measures
characteristics.description: Baseline plasma copper-related measures such as total copper and labile bound copper (LBC), as part of disease characteristics/PD profile

characteristics.name: Baseline Plasma Molybdenum
characteristics.description: Baseline plasma total molybdenum concentration

characteristics.name: Medical and Surgical History
characteristics.description: Relevant prior medical and surgical history including comorbidities related to WD and other conditions (Section 7.1.3.3)

characteristics.name: Prior WD Therapies
characteristics.description: History of prior and ongoing therapies for Wilson Disease (e.g., penicillamine, trientine, zinc, prior ALXN1840), including duration >28 days vs ≤28 days used to define Cohort 1 (treatment-experienced) and Cohort 2 (treatment-naïve)

characteristics.name: Prior and Concomitant Medications/Therapies
characteristics.description: All prior and concomitant medications and therapies summarized by Anatomical Therapeutic Chemical (ATC) class and preferred name, including those used to treat WD as noted in Section 7.1.4 and Appendix 9.2.7

characteristics.name: Baseline Laboratory Assessments
characteristics.description: Baseline clinical laboratory parameters (e.g., liver enzymes ALT, AST, GGT; INR; other safety labs) used to describe disease status and safety profile at baseline

characteristics.name: Baseline Vital Signs
characteristics.description: Vital signs at baseline (e.g., blood pressure, heart rate, respiratory rate, body temperature), summarized per Section 7.3.3.2

characteristics.name: Baseline ECG Parameters
characteristics.description: Baseline electrocardiogram parameters (e.g., QT, QTc, QTcF) summarized per Section 7.3.3.4

characteristics.name: Cohort (Treatment-experienced vs Treatment-naïve)
characteristics.description: Cohort classification based on prior WD therapy exposure: Cohort 1 (treatment experienced, >28 days of WD therapy) vs Cohort 2 (treatment naïve, ≤28 days of WD therapy)

documentContentReferences.name: Screening procedures clarified in Section 8
documentContentReferences.description: Amendment summary states that a footnote in the Schedule of Activities table is updated to state that procedures specific to screening sites (US only) are detailed in Section 8.

documentContentReferences.name: US-specific screening sites detail
documentContentReferences.description: Amendment summary notes that Section 8 adds text applicable only to the US detailing the possibility for sites to perform only screening procedures and not remaining study procedures.

documentContentReferences.name: COVID-19 vaccine risk assessment
documentContentReferences.description: Text notes that specific consideration has been given to potential risks and mitigation measures due to the COVID-19 vaccine and directs the reader to Section 10.5.

documentContentReferences.name: Dose modification reference in risk table
documentContentReferences.description: Within Table 3, the mitigation strategy for several risks includes dose modification or discontinuation with a reference to Section 6.6 for details of dose modification criteria.

documentContentReferences.name: Outpatient period extension limits
documentContentReferences.description: Text describing adaptive design indicates that adaptive features and their limits are detailed in Table 4.

documentContentReferences.name: Dose modification criteria linkage
documentContentReferences.description: Adaptive feature 4 in Table 4 refers to relevant Dose Modification criteria defined in Table 7.

documentContentReferences.name: Blood donation exclusion cross-reference
documentContentReferences.description: In the lifestyle restriction table, the restriction on blood and plasma donation refers to an exclusion criterion defined in Section 5.2.

documentContentReferences.name: Contraception cross-reference from lifestyle considerations
documentContentReferences.description: Contraception requirements reference appropriate contraceptive methods described in Section 10.4 and start times for contraceptives according to methods described in Section 5.1.

documentContentReferences.name: Schedule of Activities for study intervention discontinuation
documentContentReferences.description: Directs readers to the Schedule of Activities in Section 1.3 for data to be collected at the time of discontinuation of study intervention and follow-up.

documentContentReferences.name: Dose modification criteria for abnormal liver function
documentContentReferences.description: States that discontinuation of study intervention for abnormal liver function should be considered when conditions outlined in the Dose Modification criteria in Section 6.6 are met.

documentContentReferences.name: Pregnancy discontinuation criteria
documentContentReferences.description: Lists pregnancy or planned pregnancy as a reason for discontinuation and cross-refers to Section 8.2.6 for pregnancy details.

documentContentReferences.name: Table 1 reference for discontinuation visit procedures
documentContentReferences.description: Instructs to see the Schedule of Activities (Table 1) for samples and data to be collected at the time of study intervention discontinuation and follow-up.

documentContentReferences.name: Schedule of Activities for early discontinuation
documentContentReferences.description: Indicates that an early discontinuation visit should be conducted as shown in the Schedule of Activities and that Section 1.3 should be consulted for data to be collected at study discontinuation and follow-up.

documentContentReferences.name: ECG withdrawal criteria linkage
documentContentReferences.description: Specifies that triplicate ECGs will be conducted as outlined in the SoA (Section 1.3) and refers to Section 7 for QTc withdrawal criteria and any additional QTc readings.

documentContentReferences.name: Clinical laboratory test list and timing
documentContentReferences.description: Directs the reader to Section 10.2 for the list of clinical laboratory tests and to the SoA (Section 1.3) for timing and frequency of assessments.

documentContentReferences.name: Protocol-required laboratory assessments definition
documentContentReferences.description: States that all protocol-required laboratory assessments, as defined in Section 10.2, must be conducted according to the laboratory manual and the SoA.

documentContentReferences.name: AE/SAE linkage to discontinuation section
documentContentReferences.sectionTitle: Adverse Events and Serious Adverse Events
documentContentReferences.description: Notes that investigators remain responsible for following up AEs that caused the participant to discontinue the study intervention, with a cross-reference to Section 7 for discontinuation details.

documentContentReferences.name: Procedures for AE and SAE handling
documentContentReferences.sectionTitle: Adverse Events and Serious Adverse Events
documentContentReferences.description: States that procedures for recording, evaluating, follow-up, and reporting AEs and SAEs are outlined in Section 10.3.

documentContentReferences.name: SAE reporting timelines cross-reference
documentContentReferences.sectionTitle: Time Period and Frequency for Collecting AE and SAE Information
documentContentReferences.description: Indicates that all SAEs must be recorded and reported as indicated in Section 10.3.

documentContentReferences.name: AE/SAE detection and reporting methods
documentContentReferences.sectionTitle: Method of Detecting AEs and SAEs
documentContentReferences.description: Specifies that methods for recording, evaluating, assessing causality, and completing and transmitting SAE reports are provided in Section 10.3.

documentContentReferences.name: Lost to follow-up definition
documentContentReferences.description: States that SAEs will be followed until resolution, stabilization, explanation, or participant is lost to follow-up as defined in Section 7.3.

documentContentReferences.name: Biobanked sample genetic testing exclusion
documentContentReferences.description: Clarifies that the retained biobanked sample will not be used for genetic testing and refers to Section 8.7 for genetics.

documentContentReferences.name: PK sampling schedule
documentContentReferences.description: Specifies that whole blood samples for molybdenum measurements will be collected as specified in the SoA (Table 1).

documentContentReferences.name: Copper balance measurements cross-reference
documentContentReferences.description: Directs readers to Section 8.1.1 for details of molybdenum measured in food, drinks, urine, and feces.

documentContentReferences.name: PD sampling schedule
documentContentReferences.description: States that blood samples for PD endpoints will be collected as described in the SoA (Table 1) for plasma isolation.

documentContentReferences.name: Copper and biomarker measurement details
documentContentReferences.description: Refers readers to Section 8.6 for details of plasma copper-related biomarkers and to Section 8.1.1 for details of copper measured in food, drink, urine, and feces.

documentContentReferences.name: Populations for analysis table
documentContentReferences.description: Indicates that the population sets used for analysis are defined in Table 8.

documentContentReferences.name: Use of PK/PD Analysis Set
documentContentReferences.description: States that analyses for PK, PD, and biomarker endpoints will be performed using the PK/PD Analysis Set described in Table 8.

documentContentReferences.name: ECG analysis and SoA linkage
documentContentReferences.description: Indicates that electrocardiogram parameters will be measured at specified time points as per the SoA (Table 1).

documentContentReferences.name: IRB/IEC safety notifications
documentContentReferences.description: States that an Investigator who receives an Investigator safety report describing an SAE or other safety information from Alexion will file it with the IB and notify the IRB/IEC according to local requirements.

documentContentReferences.name: Risk rationale referencing IB
documentContentReferences.description: Within Table 3, several risk rationales cite results obtained from studies of ALXN1840 and ammonium tetrathiomolybdate in participants with Wilson disease and instruct the reader to see the Investigator’s Brochure (IB).

commentAnnotations.text: Abbreviations: ALT = alanine aminotransferase; AST = aspartate aminotransferase; IB = Investigator’s Brochure; PK = pharmacokinetics; WD = Wilson disease.
commentAnnotations.sourceSection: 2.3.1 Risk Assessment / Table 3: Potential Risks and Mitigation Strategy

commentAnnotations.text: Abbreviations: CRF = case report form; CRU = clinical research unit; EOS = End of Study; SoA = Schedule of Activities.
Abbreviations: ICF = informed consent form; PD = pharmacodynamic; PK = pharmacokinetic.
commentAnnotations.sourceSection: 9.3 Populations for Analyses / Table 8: Populations for Analysis

commentAnnotations.text: Note: total molybdenum and PUF molybdenum concentration-time profiles on Day 28 after the last 15 mg ALXN1840 dose will be extrapolated to Day 29 (0-24 hr) and subtracted from the observed Day 29 concentration-time profiles after the first 30 mg ALXN1840 dose in order to determine the actual accumulation for the 30 mg dose level.

studyDefinitionDocumentVersions.description: Substantial protocol amendment clarifying study procedures for US sites to facilitate participant recruitment and reduce inconvenience without compromising study quality.
Initial version of protocol ALXN1840-WD-204 for the Phase 2 open-label study of ALXN1840 in Wilson disease.
First protocol amendment; specific content not detailed in provided extract.
Second protocol amendment; specific content not detailed in provided extract.
Third protocol amendment; specific content not detailed in provided extract.

studyAmendmentImpacts.description: Substantial amendment to clarify study procedures across different US sites, facilitate recruitment, and lessen participant inconvenience without compromising study quality
Addition of footnote text to reference US-specific screening site procedures described in Section 8

studyAmendmentImpacts.affectedSection: Section 4.2 - Scientific Rationale for Study Design
studyAmendmentImpacts.description: Adjustment of the post-discontinuation interval for zinc from 30 days to 21 days in the scientific rationale text
Addition of US-only text allowing certain US sites to conduct screening procedures only, without performing remaining on-study procedures

studyAmendmentReasons.reasonText: The main reason for preparation of this amendment was to clarify study procedures occurring across different sites in the US, so as to facilitate participant recruitment across different regions of the US, and to lessen inconvenience for participants without compromising the quality of the study.

Addition of text to the Schedule of Activities footnote to state that procedures specific to US screening sites are detailed in Section 8, to keep the SoA aligned with the more detailed procedural description.
To align the number of days with the mention of zinc discontinuation elsewhere in the protocol.
To facilitate participant recruitment across different regions of the US and to lessen inconvenience for participants without compromising the quality of the study.

studyChanges.beforeText: Schedule of Activities (SoA), Table 1 footnote text (exact prior footnote content not provided in the excerpt) did not reference Section 8 for US-only screening site procedures.
studyChanges.afterText: Footnote to Table 1 includes added text stating that procedures specific to screening sites (only in the US) are detailed in Section 8.
studyChanges.summary: Added SoA footnote language indicating that US screening-site–specific procedures are described in Section 8, to cross-reference newly added operational options for US screening-only sites.

studyChanges.beforeText: However, the physiologic turnover of human gastrointestinal epithelial cells is 3 - 5 days (Darwich, 2014); therefore, the inhibitory effect of zinc on intestinal copper absorption is expected to be minimal 30 days after discontinuation of zinc.
studyChanges.afterText: However, the physiologic turnover of human gastrointestinal epithelial cells is 3 - 5 days (Darwich, 2014); therefore, the inhibitory effect of zinc on intestinal copper absorption is expected to be minimal 21 days after discontinuation of zinc.
studyChanges.summary: Changed the post-zinc discontinuation interval in the scientific rationale from 30 days to 21 days to align with other protocol references to zinc washout duration.

studyChanges.beforeText: Section 8 contained study assessments and procedures but did not specify that some US sites could function solely as screening sites, performing only screening procedures.
studyChanges.afterText: Section 8 includes additional text applicable only to the US that details the possibility for sites in the US to only perform screening procedures and not any of the remaining study procedures.
studyChanges.summary: Added US-only operational language to allow designated US sites to act as screening-only locations, with all non-screening study procedures conducted elsewhere.
